title: Why is multilingualism important in education? - Quora

response.answer_text: The significance of multilingualism can be summarised in a short way. In the world of “Dominant” languages, the people lag behind in the race of life skills and life option for a better life style because they don’t have access to the resources such as books, references, articles, academic perpectives and even the medium of language when they go for middle, high school or college education. If they have the access to these resources in their mother tongue or local language, they could have what we call “equity” in every aspect of life. That’s why multilingualism is important.

As the immigrant population increases, the need to speak more than one language has become very important in the classroom. Spanish seems to be the largest language. Multilingual teachers have an advantage, which makes hiring more favorable for them.
